unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked me about the diff between Voter ID, Aadhaar, PAN, and driving license. It's actually pretty simple once you break it down, bhai.
normalised: Okay, so someone asked me about the difference between Voter I-D, Aadhaar, P-A-N, and driving license. It's actually pretty simple once you break it down, bhai.

unnormalised: First off, your Voter ID (officially called an EPIC card) is primarily for voting, obviously. You'll need this, plus address proof, to cast your vote. Think of it like your citizenship proof for elections. And it's issued by the Election Commission of India, so its authenticity is solid. EPIC number starts with 3 letters, followed by numbers, something like ABC1234567.
normalised: First off, your Voter I-D (officially called an E-P-I-C card) is primarily for voting, obviously. You'll need this, plus address proof, to cast your vote. Think of it like your citizenship proof for elections. And it's issued by the Election Commission of India, so its authenticity is solid. E-P-I-C number starts with three letters, followed by numbers, something like A-B-C one two three four five six seven.

unnormalised: Then there's Aadhaar. This 12-digit number (e.g., 1234 5678 9012) is more like a general identity and address proof. You can use it for everything from opening a bank account to getting a new SIM card. Govt loves it coz it's linked to biometrics, making it harder to fake. But lately, people have been questioning its complete security since you canâ€™t change it.
normalised: Then there's Aadhaar. This twelve digit number (for example, one two three four five six seven eight nine zero one two) is more like a general identity and address proof. You can use it for everything from opening a bank account to getting a new S-I-M card. Government loves it because it's linked to biometrics, making it harder to fake. But lately, people have been questioning its complete security since you can't change it.

unnormalised: Lastly, PAN (Permanent Account Number) is essential for anything finance-related, you know, taxes and stuff. It's a 10-character alphanumeric code issued by the Income Tax Department (e.g., ABCDE1234F). It's not really an ID proof like the others, but more for tracking financial transactions, so don't use it for address proof. And driving license, well, that's pretty straightforward. Its primary purpose is to show you're legally allowed to drive, and it also acts as an ID & address proof, but only if it has your correct address on it. DL numbers vary from state to state, but usually look something like MH-01-2024-0012345, where MH is Maharashtra.
